import React from 'react'; function About() { return (

About This App

The SpaceX Launch Finder is a React web application that allows users to search and view past SpaceX launches. It fetches live data from the public SpaceX API.

What Information is Displayed?

  • Mission Name: The official name of the launch mission.
  • Date: The UTC date the mission was launched.
  • Rocket: The name of the rocket used for the mission (e.g., Falcon 9).
  • Mission Patch: A small image representing the mission's patch or logo.
  • Mission Details: A short summary or description of what the mission involved.
  • Status: Shows whether the mission was successful (✅), failed (❌), or is pending (⏳).
  • Watch Link: A link to a YouTube or SpaceX webcast of the launch (if available).

You can search by mission name using the text box on the homepage. The app is built using React, Fetch API, and React Router, and follows a component-based architecture.

); } export default About;
